intro: Symplocos nubium, commonly known as the cloud mountain waxberry, is a deciduous shrub native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its small, glossy leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are edible and often consumed by birds and small mammals. Symplocos nubium thrives in moist, acidic soils and is typically found in forested areas at high altitudes. Its ornamental value and ecological importance make it a notable species in alpine ecosystems.
